name: Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning
mission: Our mission is to teach people how to explore, understand, discuss, and practice Islam based on reason, rationality, and objective thinking.
programs: 23 Questions Series: Application of Core Principles
theoryOfChange: The Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning (GCIL), an initiative of Al-Mawrid United States (AMUS), has a published 'Strategic Plan for Al-Mawrid United States Inc.'. This document outlines high-level objectives and action steps for the organization. The objectives include providing a research and educational environment for the evolution and revisiting of Islamic religious thought, and establishing an educational institute where Islam is taught as knowledge based on reason and logic, rather than as a creed. The action steps detail how these objectives will be achieved, such as translating and supporting research, educating through online and on-premises courses, creating and disseminating audio/visual content, reaching out to local communities, and providing forums for critical questioning. Furthermore, GCIL's methodology emphasizes teaching students to prioritize research over blind belief, reason over tradition, evidence over opinion, rationale over dogmatism, and discovery over imitation.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ghamidicenter.com/donate (Source: https://ghamidicenter.com/donate)

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

all_citations.claim: AL-Mawrid United States Inc holds a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 75.2%.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and provides specific policies for the collection and distribution of zakat funds.
The organization reported total revenue of $816,038 and operates programs including Education, AskGhamidi, and Translations.
The charity offers multiple donation options and methods for supporters to contribute to its educational mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains a solid Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100, reflecting strong financial health and accountability standards [1]. While its educational mission is clear, the impact score reflects a focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing impact measurement frameworks to better quantify the long-term influence of educational programs
Increasing transparency regarding specific beneficiary reach across different global regions

dimension_explanations.alignment: AL-Mawrid is Zakat-eligible, providing a medium fit for Muslim donors seeking to support intellectual and educational advocacy [2][4]. The organization's focus on objective thinking and rationality addresses a specific niche in Islamic advocacy and religious education [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a commitment to its mission by allocating 75.2% of its $816,038 total revenue toward its programs [1][3]. Its impact is categorized as capacity building, with a calculated cost per beneficiary of 1715.795, indicating a resource-intensive scholarly and educational model [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: AL-Mawrid United States Inc promotes a rational and objective approach to Islamic education through scholarly research and global outreach.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 75.2% ensuring most funds reach core educational initiatives
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised
Substantial liquidity with 10.9 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in the United States, AL-Mawrid focuses on teaching Islamic principles through the lens of reason and rationality [1]. The organization facilitates religious understanding through its Education Program, the AskGhamidi platform, and various translation projects [3].

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="2">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and its <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite> structure. It has been <cite id="2">operating since 2014</cite> with consistent financial reporting.

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively shifting religious understanding as intended.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a small advocacy organization with <cite id="3">revenue under $1M</cite>, there is significant room to scale its global digital education platforms.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">75.2% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core educational programs, exceeding the <cite id="7">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
With <cite id="5">10.9 months of working capital</cite> held in reserve, the charity demonstrates exceptional long-term financial resilience.
AL-Mawrid has achieved a <cite id="2">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of disclosure for non-profit organizations.

strengths_deep_dive: AL-Mawrid distinguishes itself through its commitment to accountability, earning an <cite id="1">overall score of 84.84.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. This includes a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 score for Culture & Community</cite>. The organization's governance is supported by an <cite id="1">independent board</cite>, and it maintains a low overhead, spending only <cite id="8">$0.12 to raise every dollar</cite> according to Charity Navigator's assessment. Furthermore, the organization has documented a <cite id="2">clear theory of change</cite> focused on revisiting religious thought through reason, which is supported by <cite id="2">five tracked outcome metrics</cite> reported via Candid.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, AL-Mawrid United States Inc (also known as the Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning) is a non-profit organization dedicated to a <cite id="1">rational and objective approach to Islamic education</cite>. The organization operates primarily as a scholarly and research-based institute, aiming to provide an environment where <cite id="2">religious thought can continue to evolve</cite> through critical inquiry. In 2023, the charity reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $816,038</cite>, maintaining a lean operation with <cite id="4">fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>. Their core activities include education classes, Sunday schools, and the 'AskGhamidi' platform, which facilitates direct engagement with scholars. Financially, the organization is stable, holding <cite id="5">10.9 months of working capital</cite>, which provides a significant buffer for its educational and translation projects. While its primary focus is advocacy and capacity building through knowledge dissemination, it maintains a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor funds are directed toward its mission of scholarly outreach and religious literacy.
